mods.abstract: Image of group of men, women and children formally posing with memorial wreath at cenetaph located at Toronto City Hall. A soldier in uniform and a man in traditional fustanella uniform of an Evzones, each holding a Greek and British flag.Verso includes: "Toronto Greeks" and the caption "Memberse of Toronto's Greek colony marched to the Cenotaph yesterday for aservice in which the glorious victory of Koritza was celebrated. Two members of the Ryoal Canadian Air Force were chosen to place a werath on the Cenotaph, the Greek Citizens' committee explaining that as a tribute to the Royal Air Force, which contributed greatly in the battle for the capture from the Italians of Koritza. The service is pictured above, in which the werath was placed "in memory and honor of the British and Greek soldiers who died in this battle for right and freedom."
